semantic_identifier: 108: feat: Sales_Accelerator: Add RBAC enforcement for generated content actions and governance settings

sections.text:
## Description

Implements role-based access control (RBAC) across Sales_Accelerator for AI-generated content and governance settings with a default-deny posture.

Changes:
- Backend
  - Introduces centralized permission checks for generated content operations: view, generate, edit, export (emails, call notes, next-best-action recommendations).
  - Adds authorization guards to governance/settings endpoints.
  - Applies default-deny to new/previously unguarded endpoints and returns consistent 403 responses with machine-readable error codes.
  - Defines initial role -> permission mapping aligned to: SDR/AE, Manager, Sales Ops/Admin.
- Frontend
  - Wires capability flags into the UI to hide/disable restricted actions (generate/edit/export/buttons, settings navigation).
  - Adds clear user-facing messaging for blocked actions (403) and avoids surfacing governance pages to unauthorized users.

User impact:
- SDR/AE, Manager, and Sales Ops/Admin now see only the generated-content actions and governance settings they’re permitted to access.
- Unauthorized attempts are blocked server-side and surfaced with explicit error messaging.

Notes:
- Role/permission definitions are implemented as the initial baseline and can be extended without changing endpoint semantics.

## How Has This Been Tested?

staging
